questions.question: What is a requirement of all marine transmitting apparatus used aboard United States vessels?
options: Only equipment that has been certified by the FCC for Part 80 operations is authorized.
Equipment must be type-accepted by the U.S. Coast Guard for maritime mobile use.
Certification is required by the International Maritime Organization (IMO).
Programming of all maritime channels must be performed by a licensed Marine Radio Operator.
questions.answer: Only equipment that has been certified by the FCC for Part 80 operations is authorized.

questions.question: What transmitting equipment is authorized for use by a station in the maritime services?
options: Transmitters that have been certified by the manufacturer for maritime use.
Unless specifically excepted, only transmitters certified by the Federal Communications Commission for Part 80 operations.
Equipment that has been inspected and approved by the U.S. Coast Guard.
Transceivers and transmitters that meet all ITU specifications for use in maritime mobile service.
questions.answer: Unless specifically excepted, only transmitters certified by the Federal Communications Commission for Part 80 operations.
